issue.title: iota_view's iterator's binary operator+ should be improved

discussion.p:
iota_view's iterator's operator+ could avoid a copy construct by doing "i += n; return i" rather than "return i += n;" as seen in .
This is what libc++ has implemented and shipped, even though it may not technically be conforming (if a program asserted the number of copies, for example).
It might be good to update this operator and the minus operator accordingly.
Set status to Tentatively Ready after six votes in favour during reflector poll.
discussion.note: 2021-10-14 Approved at October 2021 virtual plenary. Status changed: Voting → WP.

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N4892.

blockquote.pre: friend constexpr iterator operator+(iterator i, difference_type n) requires advanceable<W>;
friend constexpr iterator operator+(difference_type n, iterator i) requires advanceable<W>;

blockquote.p: -21- Effects: Equivalent to: return i + n;

blockquote.pre: friend constexpr iterator operator-(iterator i, difference_type n) requires advanceable<W>;
